name: Specter
lore: A specter is the hateful, incorporeal remnant of a creature whose life was cut short by violence or anguish. Disembodied and restless, specters haunt the places of their demise, draining the life force of the living.
resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, and Thunder
Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from nonmagical attacks

languages.notes: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.description: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the specter has Disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage, and the target's Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a Long Rest. The target dies if its Hit Point maximum is reduced to 0.

hit.additionalEffects: The target's Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a Long Rest. The target dies if its Hit Point maximum is reduced to 0.
